comments.body: it would be awsome if this was another big mob like the wither and ender dragon. it would be cool if that was the same for the nether. so their could be nether worm and the end worm
this is a very good idea! but you should be able to relax after killing the dragon maybe put it in the end cidy?
The mermaid tail should also include water breathing. I really like this

Maybe instead of 10 coming out of the portal how about they crowd near the portal for when you enter the nether?

I love the idea of a distant relative to Endermites and Silverfish, but maybe there could be corrupted blocks in the nether (like the cobblestone that holds silverfish, but only nether based.) Maybe when someone is mining netherbrick for a building material it sometimes releases the Nethermites. The nether is a scary place for a lot of players, so maybe two can come out of the block instead of one. I like the portal idea as well, but with someone that might not have all that great of armor might get fraustrated easily, maybe like five come out when ignited.
Yeah those are pretty good idea Sun and Aptcoast
Maybe have it be rare that they become tamed, though? I always breed my cows for milk and meat and it'd kind of be unfortunate getting nothing but sweet milk
You still can breed normal cows you only get tamed cows when you breed cows with hay bales. The meat drop also stays the same and sweet milk still can be used to make cake
YES! Domestication!!! More cow Variation! Cows are the best.
Drowned tridents should have a natural Loyalty to them, so they have to wait for the trident to come back to them
Or when they are thrown, they disappear from their hands, and it takes a few seconds for it to reload.
Already happens in hard mode when the regional difficulty is high enough
I think this should be the case for all mobs, including players

The idea is wonderful! although i am against the egg, but! The Lord of the Illagers in raid will not just spam for anyone! you must have master and owned every single difficulty of bad omen to get a chance! for one of the last waves in the highest difficulty of raids for the lords to show up!

I like the idea of having A Lord of the illagers in raids, but with a rare chance of Spawning in the raid, (as in a sudden appearance)

 

I disagree with the egg spawn, I think it's best for the illager Lord, to be as special as the ender dragon (But if necessary, you can always summon it with Cheat Commands, just like the ender dragon)
Yes add lord for pillagers in raids for minecraft bedrock

1) That is a bit to strong, maybe 375 HP and 37.5 dmg

2) It needs to have special abilities, like breaking blocks, so it can't be farmed

3) You have to add it to bedrock, too
Wooden swords should work, just very slowly

@ElijahsHero yeah I have been thinking about it and wooden swords and tools not working would be somewhat op, maybe if they broke at the rate of iron drops with non-iron tools based on difficulty i.e. fists are slow on easy, wooden swords and tools are slow on normal, and stone swords and tools are slow on hard, maybe with hardcore mode having some other prerequisite

Also, maybe a player without the tools could use other methods to get out of the belly like tossing poison or hunger inducing foods while inside so that the fish regurgitates them
THATS AMAZING IT SOUNDS SOOOO COOL I REALLY HOPE MOJANG ADD THIS

no that is bad

I would actually modify this and say that like how animals drop cooked meat when burned to death, wither skeletons should be able to be burned to death (a change from the current version and perhaps more functionality from blue fire) and that only wither skeletons burned to death drop charcoal. Otherwise, a wither skeleton has no chance of dropping charcoal or coal.

A little more complicated, but I would just as well get behind the simple change of coal to charcoal.

Add a varient in ice plains as well... those places are really barren, and it would be nice to have to fight these more often. And instead of using 'Punish' use challenge. Also, make them attack other bipedal hostile mobs as well. It would make sense. Also, perhaps they would be hostile to other Strikers, the ones not in their pack.

Right now deserts feel like a place with only husks

So many Husks. If them being in hordes even though it is day time wasn't worse they also make me starve from hitting me. So deserts sure aren't empty.

Anyway, these should probably spawn with a structure instead of being randomly around.

I mean, it would discourage villager zombification farms. But it would take a lot of the excitement out of curing a zombie villager. Maybe they only have the chance turn into an illager if they had already been cured, with the chance for the conversion going up with each cure.

But which illager should the villager become? I'm thinking a vindicator, because of the name, and vindicators are the second most dangerous illager next to evokers, but those drop totems of undying, which would be way too op.
Sounds cool.
This should've been done a LONG time ago!
The quantity of xp could increase for less common variations.
I think the concept of having some monsters of being good or bad is cool. But it needs to be balanced.

Keep in mind, not everyone may have access to outside links (like YouTube, Twitter, mods, etc.). People may have certain sites blocked and can't just "look at a picture" hosted elsewhere. Please contain all the info you need for people to vote within your feedback post on this site. Everything else should be considered "extra", not required watching or reading!

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360012134952-How-to-Post-and-Edit-Feedback

Post covers mobs primarily, moving to related category. 

Please keep suggestions focused on a single idea per post.  As a helpful piece of advice, lists like this tend to not fall under items I can take to our developers because we can't tell what exactly people are voting for. Maybe you could elaborate more and separate your ideas out some? 

We want to help everyone have their ideas succeed. Thanks for your contribution.
The End is good enough.  No need for overpoweredness.
